answers.answer: "He's complained about feeling chilly when the house is actually pretty warm."He needs to see a doctor. His medication dosage may need adjustment (if he takes any as required), he may have an infection, or he may have something else going on since "He's not very good at doing everything he should be doing." and "since he doesn't share a lot with me regarding his diabetes". Too many ifs that only a doctor can decipher.

question: My husband is a Type 2 diabetic and has been for over 10 years.  He's not very good at doing everything he should be doing.  He's complained about feeling chilly when the house is actually pretty warm.  He'll make comments like 'my blood sugar hasn't been right' - since he doesn't share a lot with me regarding his diabetes - I do a lot of research on my own - is this something I should be concerned about?
title: Having Chills
